episodeTitle: Z's Ambition Arc - The Mysterious Strongest Army Appears!
description: The Straw Hats execute a rescue plan for Panz Fry, but encounter Shuzo and the Neo Marines. A three-way battle erupts between the Straw Hats, the Neo Marines, and Vice Admiral Momonga's forces.

events.title: Nami's Rescue Plan
events.description: Nami devises a two-pronged strategy to rescue Panz Fry. The plan splits the crew into a diversion group and a submarine infiltration team, though Luffy switches to the submarine group because he finds the diversion boring.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's tactical leadership and sets up the episode's main conflict. Shows Luffy's impulsiveness affecting team strategy.

events.title: Neo Marines Revealed
events.description: Shuzo and the Neo Marines make their first appearance in the series, attacking both the Marine forces and targeting Panz Fry. The Neo Marines are revealed to be former Marines who now seek to eliminate all pirates rather than imprison them.
events.significance: Introduces the primary antagonist force of the Z's Ambition Arc and establishes the three-way conflict. Sets up the ideology conflict between the Marines, Neo Marines, and pirates.

quotes.text: Pirates must be eliminated on sight. Imprisoning them is ridiculous!
quotes.speaker: Shuzo
quotes.context: Shuzo reveals the Neo Marines' radical ideology

events.title: Successful Rescue of Panz Fry
events.description: The Straw Hats successfully retrieve Panz Fry from Marine custody. Lily emotionally reunites with her father after traveling across the New World to find him.
events.significance: Achieves the episode's initial objective and provides an emotional character moment for Lily and Panz Fry before the larger conflict begins.

events.title: Momonga's Post-Timeskip Appearance
events.description: Vice Admiral Momonga appears for the first time since the timeskip, commanding the Marine forces transporting Panz Fry. He immediately engages the Straw Hats when they rescue the giant.
events.significance: Shows that the Marines continue to pursue the Straw Hats post-timeskip. Establishes Momonga's connection to the Neo Marines conflict.

events.title: Three-Way Battle Begins
events.description: A chaotic three-way battle erupts between Momonga's Marines, Shuzo's Neo Marines, and the Straw Hat Pirates. Each faction has different goals: the Marines want to arrest Panz Fry, the Neo Marines want to kill him, and the Straw Hats want to protect him.
events.significance: Creates a unique battle dynamic with three opposing forces. Demonstrates the ideological differences between justice-seeking Marines and extremist Neo Marines.

events.title: Alpacacino's Haki Cannonballs
events.description: Shuzo's pet Alpacacino, a bazooka that ate a Zoan Devil Fruit, fires Armament Haki-imbued cannonballs at Marine ships, demonstrating a unique combination of Devil Fruit powers and Haki.
events.significance: Introduces the first instance of an inanimate object using Haki through Devil Fruit powers, showcasing the creative combat abilities of the Neo Marines.

events.title: Shuzo's Rokushiki Mastery
events.description: Shuzo demonstrates his mastery of multiple Rokushiki techniques including Tekkai, Shigan, Soru, and Geppou. As a Longarm Tribe member, he uses his extended joints like flails in combination with these techniques.
events.significance: Establishes Shuzo as a formidable opponent trained by former Admiral Z. Shows that Neo Marines possess elite combat skills from their Marine training.

events.title: Luffy Kicked Into the Sea
events.description: During combat with Shuzo, Luffy is kicked into the ocean. As a Devil Fruit user, he becomes helpless in the water and begins to sink.
events.significance: Demonstrates the continuing vulnerability of Devil Fruit users and creates tension as Luffy needs rescue.

events.title: Zoro Saves Luffy from Drowning
events.description: Zoro abandons his fight with Vice Admiral Momonga to dive into the sea and rescue his drowning captain. This happens twice in the episode as Luffy is knocked into the water multiple times.
events.significance: Shows the loyalty and trust between Zoro and Luffy. Demonstrates that protecting the crew takes priority over defeating opponents.

events.title: Shuzo's Defection from the Marines
events.description: Shuzo reveals to Momonga why he quit the Marines and joined the Neo Marines under Z. He expresses frustration with the Marine system that imprisons pirates rather than eliminating them, and reveals his desire to become Z's second-in-command.
events.significance: Provides character motivation for Shuzo and explains the philosophical divide between the Marines and Neo Marines. Sets up the connection to Z and Film Z.

quotes.text: I will not stand for imprisoning pirates. They must all be eliminated!
quotes.speaker: Shuzo

events.title: Sanji vs Shuzo Confrontation
events.description: Sanji intercepts Shuzo's attack on Panz Fry and tackles him to the ground. The two pirates engage in a brief but intense confrontation before Luffy takes over.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' commitment to protecting Panz Fry and showcases Sanji's Sky Walk ability post-timeskip.

events.title: Battle Matchups Set
events.description: The episode ends with clear battle lines drawn: Luffy prepares to fight Shuzo one-on-one, while Zoro will face off against Vice Admiral Momonga. The stage is set for the next episode's climactic battles.
events.significance: Establishes the main combat matchups for the arc's conclusion. Shows Luffy taking responsibility for the strongest opponent while Zoro handles the Marine threat.

events.title: Panz Fry's Connection to Dorry and Brogy
events.description: It is revealed that Panz Fry has been friends with the giants Dorry and Brogy since childhood. This connection establishes his ties to Elbaf and the giant warrior culture.
events.significance: Creates a narrative link to earlier story arcs and establishes Panz Fry's credibility and connections within the giant community.

quotes.text: Pirates must be eliminated on sight. Imprisoning them is ridiculous!
quotes.speaker: Shuzo
quotes.context: Revealing the Neo Marines' radical ideology

quotes.text: I will not stand for imprisoning pirates. They must all be eliminated!
quotes.speaker: Shuzo
quotes.context: Explaining his defection from the Marines to Momonga

themes.description: The episode explores different interpretations of justice through three factions: the Marines' lawful justice, the Neo Marines' radical elimination approach, and the Straw Hats' protection of the innocent.
themes.symbolism: The three-way battle represents the clash of different moral philosophies in the One Piece world.

themes.description: Multiple characters demonstrate loyalty through actions: Lily's devotion to her father, Zoro's repeated rescue of Luffy, and the crew's commitment to protecting Panz Fry despite the danger.
themes.symbolism: Zoro diving into the sea represents the selfless nature of true nakama relationships.

themes.description: The episode contrasts the moderate approach of the Marines with the extremist ideology of the Neo Marines, questioning whether ends justify means.
themes.symbolism: Shuzo's defection represents how frustration with systems can lead to radicalization.

characterSpotlights.development: Shuzo is established as a formidable fighter with a tragic backstory of disillusionment with the Marines. His combat prowess and ideological conviction make him a dangerous opponent.
keyActions: Reveals his defection story to Momonga
Prepares for final battle with Luffy
quotes: Pirates must be eliminated on sight. Imprisoning them is ridiculous!
I will not stand for imprisoning pirates. They must all be eliminated!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his commitment to protecting those he considers friends, even when it means fighting both Marines and Neo Marines simultaneously.
keyActions: Gets kicked into the sea twice
Prepares for decisive battle with Shuzo

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro shows his loyalty to Luffy by repeatedly abandoning his own fight to save his captain from drowning, prioritizing crew safety over personal combat.
keyActions: Dives into the sea to save Luffy (twice)

characterSpotlights.development: Momonga represents the law-abiding Marine perspective, shocked by Shuzo's betrayal and committed to arresting Panz Fry through proper legal channels.

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-original content. The Z's Ambition Arc does not appear in the manga and serves as a promotional arc for One Piece Film: Z.

trivia.fact: This episode is part of a four-episode anime-original arc specifically created to promote One Piece Film: Z, which was released in theaters on December 15, 2012, just six days after this episode aired.
Alpacacino is the first non-canon inanimate object shown to use Armament Haki, imbuing his cannonballs with Haki to damage Luffy's rubber body.
Shuzo is the first non-canon member of the Longarm Tribe to appear in the series, as well as the first Longarm former Marine and the first Longarm shown using Armament Haki.
This is Momonga's first appearance in the anime since the two-year timeskip, though he maintains his same rank of Vice Admiral.
The opening song 'We Go!' by Hiroshi Kitadani was at episode 60 of its 72-episode run during this episode, making it one of the longest-running One Piece openings at that time.
The episode aired on December 8, 2012 in the US (simulcast) but December 9, 2012 in Japan due to timezone differences, making it one of the rare cases where the US broadcast preceded Japan.
